Also having a weird boot problem. I have 3 HD's. 1 windows. 1 spare (installed ubuntu on it) 1 with media. Whenever I boot up my PC it goes straight into windows with no option of going into linux...only way I can get here is booting thru CD, then choosing boot from harddrive. How do I fix it so I dont need a CD to boot into it?
Did you install windows after Linux?
Do you have more than one drive?
Set the Bios to boot from the HD that has grub installed.
You need to install GRUB to the Drive with windows on it then ( this won't touch windows itself, just the MBR )
GRUB is just a bootloader ( You can also install it to a floppy if you have a floppy drive )
You can also just phisically connect the Ubuntu drive where the Windows drive is
